intro: Camax guianensis, commonly known as the Guianese camax, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features large, heart-shaped leaves and produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of yellow and red. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical rainforests. The plant is valued for its ornamental beauty and has traditional uses in local medicine.
